question:
In context with the recent revival of measles cases across the world, consider the following statements:
  1. Measles attack reduces the White Blood Cells/ WBCs in the body.
  2. Many of the deaths in measles cases are due to secondary infection.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Measles affects the immune system of the body. But the number of WBC in the blood remained the same before and after a measles attack. However, the attacks will reduce the antibodies by about 73%. This affects the body’s ability to fight off other infections.  Statement 2 is correct: Many of the measles deaths are due to secondary infections and not just due to the measles virus. This constitutes a significant portion of the 100,000 people who die (out of the 7 million affected cases). This is especially critical in case of lack of vaccination.
